Andrew McGill

    • A journalist and developer
    • Washington, D.C.
    • arm5077@gmail.com

  • Experience

    • The Atlantic

      November 2015 to present
      Washington, D.C.
      • Reports and codes for the magazine's politics team, covering Washington and the 2016 campaign.
      • Managing and coding newsroom-wide efforts, including revamping readership analysis and exploring alternative storytelling.

    • National Journal

      January 2015 to November 2015
      Washington, D.C.
      • As newsroom's graphics director, coordinated interactive and static graphic design to explore and explain the political and policy issues of the day.
      • Led development of What We're Following, a "real-time newsletter" tracking political news.

    • Pittsburgh Post-Gazette

      July 2012 to December 2014
      Pittsburgh, Pa.
      • Built the Post-Gazette's computer-assisted reporting efforts. Writes data-driven stories, including a project on the mass surveillance of Pittsburgh drivers by the city's parking authority. Promoted data literacy on staff, leading both newsroom-wide and beat-specific training on computer-assisted techniques.
      • Designed online interactives and web apps, including a web scraper tracking the movements of Pittsburgh's mayor.
      • Wrote, built interactives and implemented a redesign for Pipeline, the Post-Gazette's award-winning speciality site covering natural gas development in Pennsylvania and beyond.
      • Covered Allegheny County government, examining a controversial plan to drill for natural gas in county parks and highlighting abuse at a juvenile detention facility

    • The Morning Call

      June 2010 to June 2012
      Allentown, Pa.
      • Covered local government and communities, writing stories on controversial budgets, corrupt tax collectors, police impropriety and Allentown's changing demographics.
      • Covered the Penn State sex abuse scandal from State College, Pa., digging up enterprise stories and covering Jerry Sandusky's trial.

    • The Daily Collegian

      Sept. 2006 to May 2010
      State College, Pa.
      • Served as Penn State's award-winning student newspaper's managing editor between 2009 and 2010, managing a staff of more than 130 reporters, photographers, graphic artists and editors, editing every story and supervising design.

    • Professional projects and conferences

      • Developed Philly Rap Sheet and Philly Crime Map, two award-winning websites tracking criminal arrests in Philadelphia.
      • Presented at 2013 Tech Camp Philadelphia, a two-day conference focusing on technology in education.
      • Spoke on a panel on data journalism at the Pennsylvania AP Broadcasters Assocation annual conference.

  • Education

    • Penn State Schreyer Honors College Class of 2010, B.A. journalism, 3.71 GPA
    • Cheltenham High School (Wyncote, Pa.) Class of 2006 — National Merit Finalist
